div.head: Analysis of isoforms of phospholipase C using SAXS
div.p: We analyzed protein constructs derived from one of phosphoinositide-specific phospholipase C (PLC) enzymes, PLCγ1. As all other PLC enzymes, PLCγ1 has a conserved core architecture containing an N-terminal PH domain followed by a series of EF hands, a catalytic TIM barrel and a C-terminal C2 domain. This common core unit is further elaborated by the insertion of a highly structured region (PLCγ-specific array, γSA) between the two halves of the catalytic TIMbarrel. The γSA comprises a split PH (spPH) domain flanking two tandem SH2 domains and a SH3 domain. We analyzed wt PLCγ1 and γSA from human PLCγ1, without or with SUMO-tag, high affinity complex of γSA with FGF-receptor and γSA construct lacking the SH3 domain.
Comparison of the data obtained indicates the positions of the added tag and SH3 domain.
However, we need further experimental support. In particular, we need to repeat the experiments on the complex of γSA with FGF-receptor and wt PLCγ1.
